intro: Oedera latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf oedera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Oedera latifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
